meanings.definition: A member of a criminal gang, especially one involved in organized crime.
meanings.sent1: The mobsters gathered in the dark alley to discuss their next heist.
meanings.sent2: The police were on a mission to capture the mobsters responsible for the bank robbery.
meanings.sent3: The mobsters tried to sneak past the security guard, but ended up getting caught in a comical chase.
meanings.sent4: The city was like a chessboard, with the mobsters moving their pieces strategically to control the underworld.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mobsters in their sharp suits and fedoras was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in illegal activities as part of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The mobsters were known for their involvement in smuggling contraband across borders.
meanings.sent2: She was shocked to discover her neighbor was one of the mobsters behind the counterfeit operation.
meanings.sent3: The mobsters decided to host a fake charity event to cover up their illegal activities, which was quite absurd.
meanings.sent4: The mobsters' influence spread like wildfire, corrupting every corner of the city.
meanings.sent5: The news of the mobsters' arrest sent shockwaves through the criminal underworld.
